title: $A down after Chinese equities slide
text:
Tue, Jul 28, 2015, 12:48 PM AEST - Australia Markets close in 3 hrs 12 mins $A down after Chinese equities slide AAP â€“ 38 minutes ago Print 
The Australian dollar has slipped further in the aftermath of China's sharemarket tumble. 
At 1200 AEST on Tuesday, the currency was trading at 72.65 US cents, down from 72.79 cents on Monday. 
Overnight, Chinese stockmarket regulators vowed to intervene to stem a massive sell-off triggered by last week's decline in the Caixin PMI manufacturing index. 
KEY MOVEMENTS: 
* 72.65 US cents, from 72.79 cents on Monday 
* 89.43 Japanese yen, from 89.82 yen 
* 65.50 euro cents, from 66.01 euro cents 
* 109.62 New Zealand cents, from 110.27 NZ cents 
* 46.69 British pence, from 46.90 pence 
Government bond yields: 
* CGS 5.5pct Jan 2018, 1.812%, from 1.819%, on Monday 
* CGS 4.25pct April 2026, 2.804%, from 2.839% 
* Sept 2015 10-year bond futures contract, at 97.245 (yield 2.755 pct), up from 97.215 (2.785 pct) 
* Sept 2015 3-year bond futures contract, at 98.150 (1.850 pct), up from 98.140 (1.860 per cent) 
(*Currency closes taken at 1700 AEST previous local session, bond market closes taken at 1630 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
